message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a framework for selecting certain parts of input data for the subsequent application of a neural network, which can be useful in scenarios where data transfer is a bottleneck. This work is related to machine learning, specifically deep neural networks, and computer vision, as the proposed framework can be applied to image data. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper discusses natural language processing tasks, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the proposed framework involves training both the masks and the neural network simultaneously, which is related to optimization and could place the paper in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
